channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Life Kit's advice to repair your relationship
item.description: We cannot avoid fights and disagreements in relationships. So, how do we move forward? NPR's Life Kit offers advice on repairing relationships in the midst of conflict.
item.content:encoded: We cannot avoid fights and disagreements in relationships. So, how do we move forward? NPR's Life Kit offers advice on repairing relationships in the midst of conflict.
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: Chef's soup dumpling lesson doubles as a love letter to DC's Chinatown
item.description: Chef Tim Ma, owner of Lucky Danger in Washington's Chinatown, walks us through how to fold soup dumplings in preparation for Lunar New Year celebrations.
item.content:encoded: Chef Tim Ma, owner of Lucky Danger in Washington's Chinatown, walks us through how to fold soup dumplings in preparation for Lunar New Year celebrations.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: Photos: The flying doctors of Lesotho won't let their wings be clipped
item.description: This band of airborne health workers bring essential medical care to isolated communities in the southern African nation. In addition to turbulence, they face a new obstacle: budget cuts.
item.content:encoded:
This band of airborne health workers bring essential medical care to isolated communities in the southern African nation. In addition to turbulence, they face a new obstacle: budget cuts.

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Tommy Trenchard

item.title: Amidst ongoing war, Ukrainian grandmothers are finding joy in cheerleading
item.description: Struggling with stress and depression after years of war in Ukraine, a group of friends in their fifties and sixties throw themselves into competitive cheerleading.
item.content:encoded: Struggling with stress and depression after years of war in Ukraine, a group of friends in their fifties and sixties throw themselves into competitive cheerleading.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Sunday Puzzle: Common threads
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with WWNO listener Shyra Latiolais and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with WWNO listener Shyra Latiolais and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for February 14, 2026: With Not My Job guest Arden Cho
item.description: This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with guest host Negin Farsad, special guest Arden Cho and panelists Tom Papa, Paula Poundstone, and Beth Stelling
item.content:encoded:
This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with guest host Negin Farsad, special guest Arden Cho and panelists Tom Papa, Paula Poundstone, and Beth Stelling

(Image credit: Alberto E. Rodriguez)

item.title: Meet the power couples of the 2026 Winter Games, from rivals to teammates
item.description: Some of these power couples span multiple sports, while others compete in the same discipline — or even on the same team.
item.content:encoded:
Some of these power couples span multiple sports, while others compete in the same discipline — or even on the same team.











(Image credit: Michael Steele)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: What makes a good book-to-film adaptation? We have thoughts (and favorites)
item.description: Little Women (2019), Blade Runner (1982) and more favorites from NPR staff.
item.content:encoded:
Little Women, written and directed by Greta Gerwig.'/>

Little Women (2019), Blade Runner (1982) and more favorites from NPR staff.

(Image credit: Moviestore Collection Ltd)
item.dc:creator: Glen Weldon

item.title: Dear Life Kit: I officiated their wedding. Now I think they should get a divorce
item.description: An NPR listener says they've become increasingly concerned by their friends' marriage and feels a sense of duty to fix their relationship problems. Can they tell them what they really think?
item.content:encoded: An NPR listener says they've become increasingly concerned by their friends' marriage and feels a sense of duty to fix their relationship problems. Can they tell them what they really think?
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: A woman grieving her divorce found comfort from a couple on the trail
item.description: The news of Kristi Reeves' finalized divorce hit her hard, so she grabbed her shoes and headed for the mountains. On the trail, she encountered a couple.
item.content:encoded: The news of Kristi Reeves' finalized divorce hit her hard, so she grabbed her shoes and headed for the mountains. On the trail, she encountered a couple.
